appropriations: Your Committee has amended this measure by changing the appropriations to unspecified amounts to facilitate further discussion on the measure. [12] The Department's request includes funding for a 1.0 FTE Clinical Psychologist at $145,000.00 (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt) and a 1.0 FTE Social Worker/Human Services Professional IV at $76,788.00 (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt). [12]
assumptions_and_methodology: The Judiciary's proposal for a Kona Women’s Court (“KWC”) pilot project in the Third Circuit has been updated to reflect the current version of the bill, which calls for a three-year pilot project. [10]
agency_impact: The Department of Health requests a budget of $221,788.00 (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt) to support the Kona division pilot project. [12] The Department's request is for a 1.0 FTE Clinical Psychologist ($145,000.00 (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt)) to provide forensic psychological consultation and a 1.0 FTE Social Worker/Human Services Professional IV ($76,788.00 (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt)) to conduct screenings. [12] The Department’s role has been to provide screening and assessments of possible eligible participants for the program, including forensic mental health consultation and coordination. [12]
economic_impact: The Judiciary testimony states that the cost of incarceration of just one person for three years is $277,035.10 (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt). [10] If the Kona Women's Court helps keep just six women out of prison, the program will have already paid for itself. [10]
revenue_sources: The Committee has amended this measure by changing the appropriations to unspecified amounts to facilitate further discussion on the measure. [11]
six_year_fiscal_implications: The Judiciary's updated proposal is for a three-year pilot project with a total budget of just over $1.50 (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt) million. [10] The proposed costs are $514,900.00 (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt) for fiscal year 2025-2026, $547,000.00 (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt) for fiscal year 2026-2027, and $515,000.00 (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt) for fiscal year 2027-2028. [10] The budget includes a Women's Mental Health Professional (1FTE) at an annual cost of $175,000.00 (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt). [10] It also includes Womens Behavioral Health Beds at $100,000.00 (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt) annually and a Kona Drug Court Probation Supervisor (1FTE) at $85,000.00 (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt) annually. [10] Further annual costs include a Peer Specialist (1FTE) for $80,000.00 (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt) and a Cultural Practitioner and Advisor for $30,000.00 (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt). [10] Training costs total $47,000.00 (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt), with $5,000.00 (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt) in year one and $42,000.00 (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt) in year two. [10] A Program Evaluation is budgeted for $10,000.00 (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt) in year three. [10] The Department of Health is also requesting an annual budget of $221,788.00 (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt) to support the Kona pilot project. [12]
fiscal_implications_after_6_years: If the pilot program is successful, the ultimate goal would be to expand the women’s court program to Hilo and make the program permanent after the end of the 3-year project period. [10]
updates_from_previous_fiscal_note: The Judiciary's proposal for the Kona Women's Court has been updated from a two-year to a three-year pilot project. [10] A full three-year budget has been provided by the Judiciary, with total costs of $514,900.00 (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt) for fiscal year 2025-2026, $547,000.00 (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt) for fiscal year 2026-2027, and $515,000.00 (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt) for fiscal year 2027-2028. [10] The Committee on Ways and Means amended the measure by changing the appropriations to unspecified amounts. [11] A new funding request has been submitted by the Department of Health for $221,788.00 (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt) to support the pilot with a Clinical Psychologist and a Social Worker. [12] New testimony quantifies the cost of incarceration for one person for three years at $277,035.10 (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt). [10]
